intro: Sorbus aucuparia f. macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited rowan, is a variant of the common rowan tree. It is characterized by its larger, more showy berries compared to the typical species. The plant is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Europe and parts of Asia. Its leaves are alternate, elliptical, and have serrated edges. The fruit is a red, fleshy pome that matures in late summer and is an important food source for birds and other wildlife.
